verses.verse: And Elihu answered and said:
O wise men, hear my words; and you who know, give ear to me;
for the ear tries words as the palate tastes food.
Let us choose judgment for ourselves; let us know among ourselves what is good.
For Job has said, I am righteous; also, God has turned away my right;
should I lie against my right? My wound is incurable, without transgression.
What man is like Job, who drinks up derision like water;
who goes in company with those who work iniquity, and walks with wicked men?
For he has said, It is no benefit for a man when he is accepted with God.
Therefore, O man of heart, listen to me; far be it from God to do wrong, and the Almighty, to do injustice.
For He repays man's work to him; and according to a man's way, He causes him to find.
Yea, surely God will not do wickedness, and not will the Almighty pervert justice.
Who with Him has watched over the earth? Or who has laid out the whole world?
If He sets His heart on him, if He gathers his spirit and his breath to Himself,
all flesh shall perish together, and man shall return to dust.
But if you have understanding, hear this; listen to the sound of my words:
Shall one who hates justice restrain it? Or will you condemn a righteous, mighty one;
who says to a king, O worthlessness; to nobles, O wicked one?
He who does not lift up the face of rulers, and does not regard the rich one before the poor one; for all of them are the work of His hands.
In a moment they die, and a people are shaken at midnight; yea, they pass away, and the mighty one will be turned aside with not a hand.
For His eyes are on the ways of a man, and He sees all his steps.
There is no darkness and no deathshade to hide there those who work iniquity.
For He does not appoint on man any more to go before God in judgment.
He will break mighty men without a search, and make stand others in their place.
So He knows their works; and He overturns in the night, and they are crushed.
He strikes them for their wicked deeds in the place of the ones who see,
for so they turned aside from following Him, and they did not wisely consider all His ways,
to cause the cry of the poor one to come to Him. For He hears the cry of the afflicted ones.
And He gives rest, and who can condemn? And when He hides His face, who then can see Him? Even it may be against a nation and a man together,
from the reigning of godless men, from being snares for the people.
For has any said to God, I have taken up; I will not pervert?
Besides that which I see, You teach me; if I have done iniquity, I will not do it again.
Must He repay you because you refused it? For you must choose, and not I; therefore, speak what you know.
Men of heart will say to me, and a wise man who hears me will say,
Job has not spoken with knowledge, and his words are not with insight.
Would that Job may be tried to the end, because his answers are like men of iniquity.
For he adds transgression to his sin; he claps his hands among us, and multiplies his words against God.
